document_title: Bradycardia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Dr. CKI Pham Thanh Binh said that the treatment of bradyarrhythmia will depend on the symptoms and cause of the disease. If the disease has a bradycardia but originates from abnormal physiological changes (such as athletes, bradycardia during sleep...), treatment and intervention are often not necessary. (4)
If the bradycardia is caused by the use of medication to treat another disease, the doctor may change, adjust the dosage or direct the patient to stop using certain medications that cause the bradycardia.
Some patients with symptomatic bradyarrhythmias, or bradycardia due to severe, irreversible disease, will need to be treated with the implantation of a device called a “pacemaker”. The pacemaker is implanted under the skin near the patient's heart. The pacemaker will send impulses, helping the heart rhythm return to normal.
The pacemaker is permanently implanted into the wall of the heart to send impulses for the heart to function normally
